string.base: NDAS Software is configured to reject suspend/hibernation request when devices are mounted.\r\nYou can change this behavior from Options - Advanced.
An NDAS device with the name you specified is already registered.\r\nSpecify a different NDAS device name.
An error occurred while checking duplicate NDAS device name.
This application requires administrative privileges.\r\nLog on as a user in Administrators Group and run this application again.
Loading NDASUSER.DLL failed.\r\nPlease check the installation of the software.
Window creation failed. Possibly system is running out of memory.\r\nClose other applications and try again.
Incompatible NDASUSER.DLL is installed.\r\nPlease check the installation of the software.
An error occurred during saving the registration.
The NDAS device is already registered.
'%1!s!' is registered successfully.\r\nClick the taskbar icon to use the registered NDAS device.
An error occurred while reading the file '%1!s!'.
Dismounting the NDAS device failed because a program is still using it. Close any programs that might be using it, and then try again.
The host (%1!s!) is requesting the Write Access of "%2!s!'s".\r\nDo you want to accept the request and dismount the NDAS device?
Connection to the following NDAS devices has been lost.\r\n%1!s!
Connection to the following NDAS devices are restored.\r\n%1!s!
Connection to the following devices are unstable.\r\nThe system is reconnecting to the devices...\r\n%1!s!
Are you sure you want to exit from NDAS Device Management?
Are you sure you want to dismount the NDAS device?\r\nThe dismounting may fail if some applications are accessing the NDAS device.
Are you sure you want to dismount all NDAS devices?\r\nThe dismounting may fail if some applications are accessing the NDAS device.
Are you sure you want to dismount %1!s!?\r\nThe dismounting may fail if some applications are accessing the NDAS device.
Are you sure you want to remove the %1!s!?
Are you sure you want to deregister "%1!s!"?
This RAID will run in degraded mode due to a missing/defective member and this can cause irreconcilable RAID status. Do you want to continue? (Use NDAS Bind management for more information)
Registration is finished successfully and the device is now ready to use.
Please wait while checking the NDAS device status...
Enter the NDAS device ID to register.
Specify the name for the NDAS device.

The Wizard will guide you through the NADS device registration. Before continuing to the next step, please do the following:

- Connect the NDAS device to the network.
- Turn on the NDAS device.

To continue, click "Next".
Do you want to mount this NDAS device now?
An error has occurred while setting up a Write Key.
An error occurred while disabling an NDAS device.
An error occurred while enabling an NDAS device.
An error occurred while mounting an NDAS device as Read-Only Mode.
An error occurred while mounting an NDAS device as Read/Write Mode.
An error occurred while removing a Write Key.
An error occurred while renaming an NDAS device.
An error occurred while dismounting an NDAS device.
An error occurred while deregistering an NDAS device.
An error occurred while updating an NDAS device list.
NDAS device ID is 20 characters long and it is composed of alphanumeric characters!\r\n
Changing the user interface language requires application restart. Do you want to restart the application now?
Do not show the confirmation dialog on exit
You have successfully completed the NDAS device Registration Wizard.\r\n\r\nTo close this wizard, click Finish.

You have successfully registered the NDAS device. 

However, the NDAS device is not found and cannot be connected at this time. Please check the NDAS device connection.

To close this wizard, click Finish.

You have successfully registered and the NDAS device is connected. 

However, there is no mountable NDAS device found at this time. Please check the status from the task bar icon menu.

To close this wizard, click Finish.
Are you sure you want to remove the Write Key?\r\nYou cannot mount this device as Read/Write anymore without the Write Key.

This NDAS device is being used by another host who has the Read/Write access to the NDAS device. And shared-write mode cannot be used at this time.\r\nWould you like to request the Read/Write access of the NDAS device?
Please wait while connecting to the host...
Unit Device information is not available
Do not show a confirmation dialog on removing the Write Key
Do not show a confirmation dialog on deregistering an NDAS device
Do not show a confirmation dialog on dismounting an NDAS device
Do not show a confirmation dialog on dismounting all of the NDAS devices
NDAS Device Management is running now.\r\nClick here to register a new NDAS Device to your system.
NDAS Device Management is already running.\r\nClick the task bar icon to show the menu such that you can access the features.
NDAS Device Management is already running
Please wait while mounting a requested NDAS device...
Please wait while dismounting a requested NDAS device...
The new user interface language will be applied when you restart the application.
NDAS Device Management is running now.\r\nClick the task bar icon to show the menu such that you can access the features.
Deny suspend/hibernation if there are mounted devices
Allowing suspend/hibernation may cause a data corruption and the device may not be available on resuming in multi-write mode.\r\nAre you sure you want to enable this feature?
Are you sure you want to deactivate this NDAS device?\r\nAfter deactivating, you can reactivate this device from the menu
Are you sure you want to reset the connection to this NDAS device?
A member of RAID is inaccessible or not configured correctly. RAID system will be running in degraded mode. Use NDAS Bind Management tool for more information.\r\n%1!s!
The NDAS Device is running in degraded mode
NDAS Device is running in normal status\r\n%1!s!
The RAID is now running in recovery mode. Use NDAS Bind Management tool for more information.\r\n%1!s!
Connection(s) to one or more NDAS device(s) has been recovered.\r\n%1!s!
The RAID is now fully recovered.\r\n%1!s!
The RAID is in failure state. Use NDAS Bind Management tool for more information\r\n%1!s!
NDAS Device Management\r\nNDAS Service is not available.
Migration is required. Use NDAS Bind management to migrate.
Conflicting RAID information. Use NDAS Bind management to resolve conflicts.
Do not show a warning dialog when mounting RAID in degraded mode

In the future, do not show me this dialog box.
The following hosts are using this NDAS device.\r\nSome information may not be available.
Click here to refresh the list.
Hardware Information about your NDAS device
Completing the NDAS Device Registration Wizard
Click here to save as a file.
Optionally, you can save the registration to the file for registering from other computers.
To register the NDAS device, please enter the NDAS device ID. The ID and Write Key are located on the bottom of the NDAS device.\r\n\r\nNDAS device ID is composed of 20 characters.
Please enter the NDAS device ID.
Write Key is needed for Read/Write mode. It is composed of 5 characters.
Click Next when you finish.\r\nIf the NDAS device ID and/or the Write Key is invalid, Next will not be enabled.
Please choose a name for the NDAS device. This name will be used to identify the NDAS device in your system only.
The name can be up to 30 characters long.
Welcome to the NDAS Device Registration Wizard
Do you want to mount the NDAS device to your system now?
While mounting the NDAS device, a security warning dialog may appear. You must click "Continue" to successfully mount the NDAS device. Otherwise, it will not be mounted.
Yes, I want to mount this NDAS device as Read/Write Mode.
Yes, I want to mount this NDAS device as Read-Only Mode.
No, I don't want to mount this NDAS device now.
You need to complete the following information to export the registration data.
Do not export the Write Key.
Display menus and dialogs in the following language:
Display an alert when connection to an NDAS device is lost.
Display an alert when connection to an NDAS device is unstable.
Disable Auto Play for all fixed hard drives.
Yes, I want to mount this device as Read/Write access mode.
%1!s! is now available to mount.\r\nDo you want to mount the device to your system now?
Yes, I want to mount this device as Read-Only access mode.
No, I don't want to mount this device now.

Deactivation of the NDAS device will end communication between your system and the device. However, the device is still registered on your system. This allows the device to be activated without re-registration.
You can reset the connection to the NDAS device.
You can save the registration to the file and import it from other computers.
Mounting the requested NDAS device, please wait...
Dismounting the requested NDAS device, please wait...
